intro: Phylica atrata, commonly known as the silver tree, is a distinctive shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its silver-gray, woolly leaves that are covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in spring, followed by bright red berries. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. Due to its unique appearance and ecological importance, it is a popular ornamental plant in gardens.
